block.p: Dr. Laurie Jill Harrold, a hematologist and oncologist, was married yesterday to Dr. Edward Chu, also an oncologist. The Rev. Maureen A. Gilmore-Hebert, a minister of the United Church of Christ, officiated at the Water's Edge Resort in Westbrook, Conn.

Dr. Harrold, 38, is keeping her name. She practices in Trumbull, Conn., and at St. Vincent's Medical Center and Bridgeport Hospital, both in Bridgeport, Conn. She graduated cum laude from Mount Holyoke College and received her medical degree from Wake Forest University. Her parents, Rosalyn S. Harrold and Dr. Raymond W. Harrold, live in Boxford, Mass, where her father is a consultant on small-business management and finance.

Dr. Chu, 41, is an associate director of the Yale Cancer Center in New Haven, where he is in charge of the Veterans Affairs oncology program. He is also an associate professor of medicine and pharmacology at the Yale Medical School. He graduated magna cum laude from Brown University, from which he also received a master's degree in pharmacology and his medical degree. His parents, Dr. Ming-Yu Chu and Dr. Shih-Hsi Chu of Barrington, R.I., are emeritus professors at Brown, where they specialized in cancer pharmacology and the development of experimental drugs.
